thread.title: Texas football player allegedly stabs his father after fight at practice
thread.title_full: Texas football player allegedly stabs his father after fight at practice

title: Texas football player allegedly stabs his father after fight at practice
text:
Texas football player allegedly stabs his father after fight at practice Resize Text By Cindy Boren October 14 at 9:43 AM Follow @cindyboren 
A 16-year-old football player in Texas was taken into custody Monday night after he allegedly stabbed his father after a fight at football practice continued at their home. 
Details remain sketchy, but the teen, according to the Sugar Land Police Department, and his father quarreled when the father found out his son had been skipping practice at Clements High School. The son is a junior and plays for the varsity team. 
The argument continued after the two returned home, KHOU.com reports , and police said the teen grabbed a knife and stabbed his 45-year-old father repeatedly in the stomach, back and arms. 
“Clearly there are some issues going on in this house,” Sugar Land police spokesman Doug Adolph told KHOU. “This just isn’t a normal situation.” After spending most of her career in traditional print sports journalism, Cindy began blogging and tweeting, first as NFL/Redskins editor, and, since August 2010, at The Early Lead. She also is the social media editor for Sports. sports Success! Check your inbox for details. You might also like: Please enter a valid email address Sign Up
